title: Seems like it's fine to int on ARAM
body:
* You can run straight into the enemy everytime not giving a shit, even after 8 times

* You can build AD on Thresh but never auto a single time an enemy champion

* You can build AD Zilean and never ult anyone and never speed anyone but yourself

* You can AFK and then flame your team after you dashed into the enemy team for umpteenth time and not get "supported" when everyone is low and pushed under turret

Will start inting too everytime, playing mostly ARAM since a year+ and never got the message that a player I reported got punished even though I report this kind of behaviour everytime.
I'll start being a toxic asshole too since clearly these people have no remorse in ruining my games, why should I have them in ruining theirs?

replies.body: To be fair here, everything you've stated isn't actually intentional feeding. It could be, but it could also not be.

What is "intentional feeding" to you?

For me is keep running into the enemy team after you already did it a number of times and knowing that nobody will follow for various reason so you're going in alone against 5 of them.

Example: Urgot, without even a complete item, presses E into the enemy team, activates W and tries to fight 5 people while his whole team is clearing a wave under turret and is very low and already told him that other than a Morgana spellshield nobody will follow him.
And this is the 4th time.

What's your definition?

> knowing that nobody will follow for various reason so you're going in alone against 5 of them.

This is a matter of tactical dispute and not actually intentional feeding. If he wants to go in and wants you to follow him and you never do, then it's not actually intentional feeding as much as it is being stubborn.

That's literally intentional feeding.

He knows the team will not back him up but he will keep going 1v5 everytime not giving a shit of what his teammates just told him.

He's not literally intentionally feeding. He's probably pissed that you aren't following him though. That makes him stubborn, but in a team game, you have to realize that if I go in and you do not, you've ruined my idea of a good play. HOWEVER, everyone has their own idea of what a good play would be, and someone has to go in first to initiate. Sure he sucks at initiating, but who else will? Teamfighting is definitely one of the more awkward things about the game because it can end up being really uncoordinated when everyone has their own idea of what is about to go down, only to have them all disappoint each other.

That's bad communication, that you expect someone to go in, they don't and you look like a retard for going alone.
I can insec someone in front of my Malzahar but if the guy didn't expect me to do it and wasn't ready to ult him, that was communication, maybe I died too for it.
What happens is that I say "Sorry, mb" and try to ping more and communcate prior by typing to my team.

But when you clearly says to somebody that you won't go in and not follow them, and they still go in multiple times, that's intentional feeding, I couldn't care less of his reasoning precess, the outcome will remain the same of him dying alone since his team already told him they will not back him up.

Nobody told him "Urgot you should engage for us", he just kept going in, kept dying.

Like I understand what situation you're describing but this is not one of those, the guy didn't listen to his team and feed multiple kills when he was told nobody would help him.

Stubborn or not, that's feeeding, and he intentionally fed.

Half of league players would be banned, especially top lane if doing the same thing over and over again was punishable. I see top lane go into a fight over and over and lose constantly, getting further and further behind, but it's not intentional. They just don't know how to play safe.
